thread.title: M'sia yet to improve on human rights issues, says Amnesty
thread.title_full: M'sia yet to improve on human rights issues, says Amnesty

title: M'sia yet to improve on human rights issues, says Amnesty
text:
More 
aysia continues to be plagued by similar human rights issues, Amnesty International Malaysia says. 
Among the major concerns in Malaysia that Amnesty International raised are crackdowns on the rights to freedom of expression and the lack of police accountability. 
They also identified four other issues in their 408-page annual report released today, where Malaysia has yet to show improvements on human rights in the year 2016. 
The four other areas are freedoms of assembly and association, arbitrary arrests and detentions, refugees and asylum-seekers and the death penalty.
